intro: Agathosma cordata, commonly known as Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Agathosma cordata is also valued as a source of essential oils, particularly for its use in perfumery and aromatherapy.
